TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {144240=2.40 GHz E5-2665/115W 8C/20MB Cache/DDR3 1600MHz-2 (Sub-component of UCS B200 M3 Blade Server w/o CPU, mem, HDD, mLOM/mezz (UPG)), 211555=You can optionally install a Cisco WebEx Node For MCS (on a MCS or on a virtual machine) that can accommodate up to 500 web sessions. You can add additional Cisco WebEx Node For MCS to increase the number of web meetings, up to a maximum of four, for a total of 2000 web sessions (overall, not in a single meeting), in multinode deployments with Cisco WebEx scheduling., 167031=1750, 166731=1250, 117897=8GB DDR3-1600-MHz RDIMM/PC3-12800/dual rank/1.35v, 158422=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 129199=R2XX-CMAG3-1032, 167214=1328, 182804=Cisco ASR 1000 router, 193998=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 205929=Table: Audio and Video Scalability Numbers for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace lists the maximum number of calls that are supported. The table assumes that the G.711 audio codec is being used and video is 320 Kbps. Many design external transcoding resources on DSP farms in Multiservice Routers to transcode G.722/G.729/iLBC codecs to G.711 before sending to MeetingPlace to achieve the G.711 codec capacities. See Planning the Capacity of your Cisco Unified MeetingPlace System for detailed information about System Resource Units (SRUs) that are used to calculate the capacity of the Express Media Server. textBeforeTable: Component-specific requirements are indicated in the following table: LAN connection must support up to 1GB/s Install one virtual machine, per blade on a supported Cisco Unified Computer Server (UCS) For the Cisco UCS C200 M2, VMware ESXi 4.1 supports the VMware Standard or Enterprise Plus Edition license. VMware ESXi 4.1 supports only the VMware Enterprise Plus Edition VMware license for the Cisco UCS C240 M3, the Cisco UCS C220 M3, the Cisco UCS C210 M2, the Cisco UCS B200 M3, the Cisco UCS B200 M2. VMware ESXi 5.0 and 5.0 Update 1 (Release 8.5.5 [8.5 MR3] only) supports both the VMware Standard license and the VMware Enterprise Plus Edition license for the Cisco UCS C240 M3, the Cisco UCS C220 M3, the Cisco UCS C210 M2, the Cisco UCS C200 M2, the Cisco UCS B200 M3, and the UCS B200 M2. Virtual Machine Requirements For information about how to configure RAID settings on the UCS B or C series server, see the "Installing on a Virtual Machine" section of the Installation, Upgrade, and Migration Guide for Release 8.5 at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/ps5664/ps5669/prod_installation_guides_list.html. For scalability information, see Scalability for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Release 8.5. For system capacity information, see
textAfterTable: You must install VMware Tools when installing Cisco Unified MeetingPlace on a virtual machine. Failing to install VMware Tools can lead to serious performance degradation of the system in certain circumstances. For more information about the Enterprise Plus Edition VMware license, see http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=1010839. Supported Cisco UCS C Series Servers (General-purpose rack-mountable servers) Note: Cisco UCS requires dedicated servers for each component of Cisco Unified MeetingPlace software.
